title: cygan
author: cygan
content: yesterday i accidentally stumbled across these Offline Cash Bitcoin notes on twitter and would like to know if any of you already know them and at best already have them in their collection.from the design point of view i find these very successful. these notes come (as usual with the Polymerbit notes) with no hologram but have a nfc chip.here are some pictures of the cool notes and more infos can be found on the official homepage - the company is based in the us statesðŸ‘‰https://www.offline.cash/

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I am in a waitlist as well - have talked to them about doing a group buy as well - they have a thread here on the forums - will add it to my post in a fewhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5401680.msg60311581#msg60311581

comments.author: JanEmil
comments.body: What does claim before mean? Does they expire? Not a privat key?

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: JanEmil on June 12, 2022, 07:20:39 PMWhat does claim before mean? Does they expire? Not a privat key?the notes have a nfc chip that works as a second key for multisig - after the date specified - that key will no longer be needed. so if someone had the user set key they could take the funds even if they did not have the note. if you "re-keyed" the user key than you are fine after that date that is how I understand it at least.

comments.author: ccamrobertson
comments.body: Thanks for posting @cygan! I forgot too add here QuoteWhat does claim before mean? Does they expire? Not a privat key?@MoparMiningLLC has this exactly right. Expire means the multisig downgrades from 2-2 (user key on note, encrypted manufacturer key on note) to just the user key. This is important, as if you have not re-keyed the note at this time a previous holder can rush to spend from the script. If you store the cash for a while, you probably want to re-key. (if not loaded originally by someone trusted, e.g. family). If you hold in your (physical) wallet for spending soon, you're probably fine to leave the note as is.
